COND_126.name: Postural Orthostatic Tachycardia Syndrome
COND_126.description: Dysautonomia characterized by excessive heart rate increase upon standing

treatment_protocols.name: Standard Postural Orthostatic Tachycardia Syndrome Protocol

COND_127.name: Vestibular Neuritis
COND_127.description: Acute inflammation of vestibular nerve causing vertigo

treatment_protocols.name: Standard Benign Paroxysmal Positional Vertigo Protocol

COND_129.name: Meniere's Disease
COND_129.description: Inner ear disorder causing vertigo, hearing loss, and tinnitus

COND_130.name: Concussion/Mild Traumatic Brain Injury
COND_130.description: Mild traumatic brain injury from impact or acceleration

treatment_protocols.name: Standard Concussion/Mild Traumatic Brain Injury Protocol

COND_131.name: Post-Concussion Syndrome
COND_131.description: Persistent symptoms following concussion beyond expected recovery time

COND_132.name: Developmental Coordination Disorder
COND_132.description: Motor coordination difficulties affecting daily activities in children

COND_133.name: Autism Spectrum Disorder - Motor Issues
COND_133.description: Motor coordination and sensory processing challenges in autism spectrum disorder

treatment_protocols.name: Standard Autism Spectrum Disorder - Motor Issues Protocol

COND_134.name: Cerebral Palsy - Spastic
COND_134.description: Non-progressive motor disorder with spasticity from early brain injury

COND_135.name: Down Syndrome - Motor Delays
COND_135.description: Motor development delays and hypotonia associated with Down syndrome

treatment_protocols.name: Standard Down Syndrome - Motor Delays Protocol

COND_136.name: Muscular Dystrophy - Duchenne
COND_136.description: Progressive muscle weakness and degeneration, X-linked genetic disorder

COND_137.name: Spinal Muscular Atrophy
COND_137.description: Progressive motor neuron disease causing muscle weakness and atrophy

exercises.name: Active Range of Motion - All Joints

COND_139.name: Guillain-Barré Syndrome
COND_139.description: Acute autoimmune polyneuropathy causing ascending weakness

COND_141.name: Phantom Limb Pain
COND_141.description: Persistent pain sensation in amputated limb

COND_142.name: Lower Limb Amputation
COND_142.description: Amputation of lower extremity requiring rehabilitation and prosthetic training

COND_144.name: Osteoporotic Fracture
COND_144.description: Fracture due to bone density loss in elderly patients

COND_145.name: Sarcopenia
COND_145.description: Age-related loss of muscle mass, strength, and function

COND_146.name: Frailty Syndrome
COND_146.description: Age-related decline in physiological reserves and function

COND_147.name: Cancer Cachexia
COND_147.description: Complex metabolic syndrome with muscle wasting in cancer patients

COND_148.name: Chemotherapy-Induced Peripheral Neuropathy
COND_148.description: Nerve damage and dysfunction from chemotherapy treatment

COND_149.name: Radiation Fibrosis
COND_149.description: Tissue fibrosis and restriction following radiation therapy

COND_150.name: Industrial Back Injury
COND_150.description: Work-related back injury requiring occupational rehabilitation

COND_151.name: Temporomandibular Joint Dysfunction (TMJ)
COND_151.description: Dysfunction of the temporomandibular joint causing pain and limited jaw movement

COND_152.name: Cervical Facet Joint Syndrome
COND_152.description: Pain and stiffness from cervical facet joints

treatment_protocols.name: Standard Cervical Facet Joint Syndrome Protocol

COND_153.name: Cervical Spondylosis
COND_153.description: Age-related wear and tear of cervical spine discs and joints

COND_154.name: Whiplash Associated Disorder
COND_154.description: Neck injury from sudden acceleration-deceleration force

COND_155.name: Thoracic Outlet Syndrome
COND_155.description: Compression of nerves/vessels in thoracic outlet

COND_157.name: Costochondritis
COND_157.description: Inflammation of cartilage connecting ribs to breastbone

COND_158.name: Shoulder Impingement Syndrome
COND_158.description: Compression of rotator cuff tendons under acromion

COND_159.name: Bicipital Tendinopathy
COND_159.description: Inflammation or degeneration of biceps tendon

COND_160.name: Medial Epicondylalgia (Golfer's Elbow)
COND_160.description: Tendinopathy of medial elbow flexor-pronator muscles

COND_161.name: Ulnar Nerve Entrapment (Cubital Tunnel)
COND_161.description: Compression of ulnar nerve at elbow

treatment_protocols.name: Standard Ulnar Nerve Entrapment (Cubital Tunnel) Protocol

COND_162.name: Dupuytren's Contracture
COND_162.description: Progressive thickening and contracture of palm fascia

COND_163.name: Trigger Finger (Stenosing Tenosynovitis)
COND_163.description: Inflammation of finger flexor tendon sheath

COND_164.name: Femoroacetabular Impingement (FAI)
COND_164.description: A condition where bone overgrowth around the hip joint leads to abnormal contact between the femur and acetabulum, causing pain and restricted motion.
signs_symptoms: Reduced hip flexion and internal rotation
COND_164.pathophysiology: Structural abnormalities (cam or pincer lesions) cause abnormal contact between femoral head/neck and acetabular rim, leading to labral tears and cartilage damage.

outcome_measures: Hip Disability and Osteoarthritis Outcome Score (HOOS)

COND_165.name: Piriformis Syndrome
COND_165.description: Piriformis muscle irritation of sciatic nerve

COND_166.name: Iliotibial Band Syndrome (ITBS)
COND_166.description: Overuse injury characterized by inflammation and pain along the iliotibial band, commonly occurring at the lateral knee where the ITB crosses the lateral femoral epicondyle.
signs_symptoms: Pain increases with knee flexion at 20-30 degrees
COND_166.pathophysiology: Repetitive friction of the ITB over the lateral femoral epicondyle during knee flexion/extension cycles, leading to inflammation and pain.

outcome_measures: Knee Injury and Osteoarthritis Outcome Score (KOOS)

COND_167.name: Patellar Tendinopathy (Jumper's Knee)
COND_167.description: Chronic overuse injury of the patellar tendon characterized by pain and dysfunction, commonly seen in jumping and cutting sports.
signs_symptoms: Pain worse with jumping and landing
COND_167.pathophysiology: Repetitive loading leads to tendon degeneration, collagen disruption, and failed healing response with neovascularization and nerve ingrowth.

outcome_measures: Knee Injury and Osteoarthritis Outcome Score (KOOS)

COND_168.name: Shin Splints (Medial Tibial Stress Syndrome)
COND_168.description: Exercise-induced pain along the medial tibial border caused by repetitive stress and overuse, common in runners and athletes.
COND_168.pathophysiology: Repetitive stress causes periosteal inflammation, microtears in muscle attachments, and possible stress reactions in the tibia.

treatment_protocols.name: Standard Shin Splints (Medial Tibial Stress Syndrome) Protocol

COND_169.name: Compartment Syndrome (Chronic)
COND_169.description: Exercise-induced pain and swelling in muscle compartments of the lower leg due to increased pressure within tight fascial compartments.
COND_169.pathophysiology: Exercise increases muscle volume and blood flow, creating elevated pressure within non-compliant fascial compartments, compromising circulation and nerve function.

COND_170.name: Morton's Neuroma
COND_170.description: Thickening of tissue around nerves between the toes, most commonly between the third and fourth toes, causing pain and numbness.
signs_symptoms: Feeling of walking on a pebble
COND_170.pathophysiology: Compression and irritation of the interdigital nerve between metatarsal heads leads to nerve thickening, fibrosis, and pain.

COND_171.name: Posterior Tibial Tendon Dysfunction
COND_171.description: Progressive condition involving degeneration and dysfunction of the posterior tibial tendon, leading to loss of medial arch support and flatfoot deformity.
signs_symptoms: Inability to perform single heel rise
COND_171.pathophysiology: Tendon degeneration leads to loss of arch support, progressive collapse of medial longitudinal arch, and eventual hindfoot valgus deformity.

treatment_protocols.name: Standard Posterior Tibial Tendon Dysfunction Protocol

COND_172.name: Parkinson's Disease
COND_172.description: Progressive neurodegenerative disorder characterized by motor symptoms including tremor, rigidity, bradykinesia, and postural instability.
COND_172.pathophysiology: Progressive loss of dopaminergic neurons in the substantia nigra leads to decreased dopamine production and motor control dysfunction.

COND_173.name: Multiple Sclerosis
COND_173.description: Chronic autoimmune demyelinating disease of the central nervous system causing varied neurological symptoms and disability.
COND_173.pathophysiology: Autoimmune destruction of myelin sheaths in the CNS leads to impaired nerve conduction, inflammation, and neurodegeneration.

COND_174.name: Spinal Cord Injury (Incomplete)
COND_174.description: Partial damage to the spinal cord resulting in incomplete loss of motor and sensory function below the level of injury.
COND_174.pathophysiology: Trauma causes primary injury with cell death and secondary injury from inflammation, ischemia, and excitotoxicity, resulting in partial spinal cord damage.

outcome_measures: Walking Index for Spinal Cord Injury (WISCI)

COND_175.name: Fibromyalgia
COND_175.description: Chronic pain disorder characterized by widespread musculoskeletal pain, fatigue, and tender points throughout the body.
COND_175.pathophysiology: Central sensitization leads to altered pain processing, with increased sensitivity to painful and non-painful stimuli.

COND_176.name: Scoliosis (Adolescent Idiopathic)
COND_176.description: Three-dimensional spinal deformity occurring in adolescents without an identifiable cause, characterized by lateral curvature and vertebral rotation.
COND_176.pathophysiology: Unknown etiology involving genetic, biomechanical, and neuromuscular factors leading to asymmetrical spinal growth and three-dimensional deformity.

COND_177.name: Forward Head Posture
COND_177.description: Anterior positioning of head relative to shoulders

COND_178.name: Flat Foot (Pes Planus)
COND_178.description: Collapse of longitudinal arch of foot

COND_179.name: Pelvic Floor Dysfunction
COND_179.description: Impaired function of pelvic floor muscles

COND_182.name: MCL Tear (Medial Collateral Knee)
COND_182.description: Tear of medial collateral ligament of knee

outcome_measures.name: Knee Injury and Osteoarthritis Outcome Score

treatment_protocols.name: Standard MCL Tear (Medial Collateral Knee) Protocol

COND_183.name: Wrist TFCC Tear (Triangular Fibrocartilage)
COND_183.description: Tear of triangular fibrocartilage complex in wrist

treatment_protocols.name: Standard Wrist TFCC Tear (Triangular Fibrocartilage) Protocol

COND_186.name: Gluteal Tendinopathy
COND_186.description: Chronic degeneration and inflammation of the gluteal tendons, commonly affecting the gluteus medius and minimus insertions at the greater trochanter

COND_187.name: Quadriceps Tendinopathy
COND_187.description: Chronic degeneration of the quadriceps tendon, typically at the superior pole of the patella or musculotendinous junction

outcome_measures: Victorian Institute of Sport Assessment - Patella (VISA-P)

COND_188.name: Calf Strain (Gastrocnemius)
COND_188.description: Acute muscle strain affecting the gastrocnemius muscle, commonly occurring at the musculotendinous junction

COND_189.name: Quadriceps Strain
COND_189.description: Acute muscle strain affecting the quadriceps muscle group, commonly involving the rectus femoris at the musculotendinous junction

COND_190.name: Adductor Strain (Groin)
COND_190.description: Acute muscle strain affecting the adductor muscle group, commonly involving the adductor longus or magnus

outcome_measures: Oslo Sports Trauma Research Center Questionnaire

COND_191.name: Pectoralis Major Strain
COND_191.description: Acute muscle strain affecting the pectoralis major, commonly occurring at the musculotendinous junction or tendon insertion

outcome_measures: Disabilities of Arm, Shoulder and Hand (DASH)

COND_192.name: Colles Fracture Recovery
COND_192.description: Post-fracture rehabilitation following a distal radius fracture (Colles fracture), typically after cast removal or surgical fixation

outcome_measures: Disabilities of Arm, Shoulder and Hand (DASH)

COND_193.name: Hip Fracture Recovery
COND_193.description: Post-surgical rehabilitation following hip fracture repair, including femoral neck, intertrochanteric, or subtrochanteric fractures

outcome_measures: Disabilities of Arm, Shoulder and Hand (DASH)

COND_194.name: Tibial Stress Fracture
COND_194.description: Overuse injury resulting in incomplete fracture of the tibia, commonly affecting runners and athletes

COND_195.name: Elbow Osteoarthritis
COND_195.description: Degenerative joint disease affecting the elbow joint, causing pain, stiffness, and functional limitation

outcome_measures: Disabilities of Arm, Shoulder and Hand (DASH)

COND_196.name: Wrist Osteoarthritis
COND_196.description: Degenerative joint disease affecting wrist joint structures with cartilage loss, pain, and functional limitation

outcome_measures: Disabilities of Arm, Shoulder and Hand (DASH)

COND_197.name: Ankle Osteoarthritis
COND_197.description: Degenerative joint disease affecting ankle joint with cartilage loss, pain, stiffness, and mobility limitations

COND_198.name: Radial Nerve Entrapment
COND_198.description: Compression of radial nerve causing weakness, numbness, and functional impairment in wrist extension and thumb movement

outcome_measures: Disabilities of Arm, Shoulder and Hand (DASH)

COND_199.name: Peroneal Nerve Entrapment
COND_199.description: Compression of peroneal nerve causing foot drop, numbness, and functional gait impairments

COND_200.name: Tarsal Tunnel Syndrome
COND_200.description: Compression of posterior tibial nerve causing plantar foot pain, numbness, tingling, and functional limitations

COND_143.name: Upper Limb Amputation
COND_143.description: Amputation of upper extremity requiring rehabilitation and prosthetic training
